body_html:
Thanks @vishwakftw.
2. But even if that will be the case, it should be still possible to compute the mean carrier measure, because it could just be a property, right?
3. I still think that returning Variables is safer, and we will be able to remove most checking code once Variables and Tensors are merged. You could even just have an assert that checks that args aren't tensors.
body_text:
Thanks @vishwakftw.
2. But even if that will be the case, it should be still possible to compute the mean carrier measure, because it could just be a property, right?
3. I still think that returning Variables is safer, and we will be able to remove most checking code once Variables and Tensors are merged. You could even just have an assert that checks that args aren't tensors.
body:
Thanks @vishwakftw. 
2. But even if that will be the case, it should be still possible to compute the mean carrier measure, because it could just be a property, right?
3. I still think that returning Variables is safer, and we will be able to remove most checking code once Variables and Tensors are merged. You could even just have an assert that checks that args aren't tensors.
